metadata.sermon_title: Lachen und Essen – Das christliche Abendmahl
metadata.sermon_start_end: Sölle: Wir möchten diese Bibelarbeit nicht mit Auslegung und Anwendung des Textes beginnen, sondern gleich in das Thema Kirche und Erneuerung der Kirche hineinspringen. Eine Grunderfahrung, die ich in den letzten zehn Jahren immer wieder mache, sieht so aus [...] Teilen und Heilen gehören mitten in die Frömmigkeit hinein, die wir im Abendmahl zelebrieren. Wir sollten die Ungerechtigkeit der Schuldenfalle in unsere Liturgien einbeziehen, sie gehören dorthin.

1_specific_bible_passage.findings: The sermon uses 1 Corinthians 11 as a framework, but it functions more as a thematic launchpad for social justice than as a unique word found 'nowhere else'. The text is treated as a general endorsement of solidarity rather than a specific revelation.
quotes: Wir möchten diese Bibelarbeit nicht mit Auslegung und Anwendung des Textes beginnen, sondern gleich in das Thema Kirche und Erneuerung der Kirche hineinspringen.
1_specific_bible_passage.improvement_point: Avoid treating the text as a secondary confirmation of pre-existing social ideals; identify the specific linguistic or theological 'surplus' in the Corinthian situation that is absent in general humanitarianism.

2_exegesis_original_context.findings: The exegesis is adequate in its historical-sociological reconstruction (barley porridge vs. fine food), reflecting the humanities-based approach Dekker requires. However, it leans heavily on social-class conflict, potentially narrowing the theological scope.
quotes: Die wohlhabenden Damen und Herren fanden die Vorstellung unangenehm, Gerstenbrei zu essen.
Diese Vorstellung von Heiligkeit stammt aus der jüdischen Tradition.
2_exegesis_original_context.improvement_point: Deepen the exegesis beyond sociology to include the specific Christological 'mystery' of the 'Lord's Body' which Paul uses to ground his ethics.

3_application_concrete_contemporary.findings: Application is highly concrete, addressing specific political and social issues (Silicon Valley, debt in Mozambique, LGBTQ+ inclusion). It avoids 'general truths' by naming specific places and people.
quotes: Paolo Alto hat die höchste Brustkrebsrate der Welt
Ein Beispiel aus Mosambique: Sauda ist ein Baby, gerade einen Tag alt.
3_application_concrete_contemporary.improvement_point: Ensure the application flows from the text's authority rather than just being a parallel narrative of modern activism.

4_interwoveness_exposition_application.findings: The sermon is strictly partitioned into 'What is Church today', 'Then in Corinth', and 'Stories of today'. This separation is exactly what Dekker warns against, as it makes the relevance of the text a post-script to the experience.
4_interwoveness_exposition_application.improvement_point: Dissolve the chronological headers. Integrate the Corinthian conflict directly into the modern examples to create a single 'present of revelation'.

5_three_parts_misery_redemption_gratitud.findings: Misery is externalized as social injustice (debt, pollution). Redemption is seen as 'sharing and healing'. The psychological depth of 'misery before God' is largely replaced by 'misery before the global economy'.
quotes: Gott ereignet sich da, wo Teilen und Heilen geschieht.
5_three_parts_misery_redemption_gratitud.improvement_point: Reclaim the vertical dimension of misery (sin/estrangement from God) to prevent the sermon from becoming purely horizontal/sociological.

6_two_ways_seriousness_of_choice.findings: The sermon addresses the 'lostness in time' through social destruction. It takes the choice of the rich seriously—they must change or stay away. However, the 'eternal' dimension is absent.
quotes: Er sagt, es geht um Tod und Leben der Gemeinde.
Die Reichen, wenn sie nicht teilen wollen, müssen zu Hause bleiben.
6_two_ways_seriousness_of_choice.improvement_point: Connect the social 'lostness' more clearly to the theological consequence of 'eating judgment upon oneself' mentioned in the text.

7_christocentric_grace.findings: Christ is mentioned as a 'sign of solidarity' and 'memory', but less as the 'One Lord' who is the telos. Grace is interpreted as social forgiveness (debt relief) rather than the ontological salvation of the sinner.
quotes: Das geteilte Brot wird zum Zeichen der solidarischen Gemeinschaft
Die Erinnerung an Jesus war das Band der Einigung
7_christocentric_grace.improvement_point: Focus on Christ as the 'One Lord' (Thesis 7) whose divine nature is the source of the community's life, not just a historical model for sharing.

8_depth_and_length.findings: The length is sufficient for 'breadth'. It allows for detailed storytelling and historical context, meeting the 20-minute threshold easily.
8_depth_and_length.improvement_point: Maintain the breadth but shift the focus from 'experience' to 'exposition' to achieve the 'depth' Miskotte refers to.

overall_assessment.summary: The text functions more as a 'Bible study' or 'theological dialogue' than a sermon in Dekker's sense. It fails the formal requirement of interwovenness by strictly separating history from the present. Substantively, it prioritizes the 'human subject' (misery as social injustice) to the point of obscuring the 'One Lord' as the telos of the proclamation.
strengths: Concrete application that avoids vague generalities.
Strong use of humanities (sociology, history) to illuminate the text's context.
Sufficient length to allow for complex themes.
weaknesses: Structural separation of exposition and application.
Christ is treated as a symbol of solidarity rather than the acting Subject of the Word.
overall_assessment.final_judgment_according_to_dekker: This is an adequate theological speech on social ethics, but it is not a 'sermon' according to Dekker's theses because it lacks the actualization of the Word where the text itself—and not the experience of the speakers—is the primary actor.
